storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect scheduling conflicts in real-time to achieve efficient resource allocation.

testCases.title: Validate conflict detection with overlapping schedules
preconditions: User is authenticated and logged into the scheduling system
At least one existing booking is present in the scheduling database
User has permissions to create new scheduling requests
API endpoint /api/schedule/check is accessible and operational
Scheduling database is online and responsive

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and access the new booking form
steps.expectedResult: New booking form is displayed with all required fields (date, time, resource, duration)

steps.action: Enter scheduling details that overlap with an existing booking (same resource, overlapping time slot)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and displays entered values correctly

steps.action: Submit the scheduling request by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and performs conflict detection within 2 seconds

steps.action: Observe the system response for conflict detection alert
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays an alert message to the user indicating the scheduling conflict with details of the overlapping booking

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict log section in the system
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log interface is displayed with list of all detected conflicts

steps.action: Check the conflict log for the newly detected conflict entry
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is recorded in the system with timestamp, conflicting schedules, resource details, and user information

steps.action: Review the alert message displayed to the user
steps.expectedResult: Alert provides clear information about the conflict and offers actionable options for resolution (e.g., modify time, select different resource, cancel request)

postconditions: Conflict is logged in the system database
User is aware of the scheduling conflict
New conflicting booking is not created
System is ready to accept new scheduling requests

testCases.title: Ensure no false positives in conflict detection
preconditions: User is authenticated and logged into the scheduling system
Existing bookings are present in the scheduling database
User has permissions to create new scheduling requests
API endpoint /api/schedule/check is accessible and operational
Scheduling database is online and responsive

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and access the new booking form
steps.expectedResult: New booking form is displayed with all required fields available for input

steps.action: Enter scheduling details that do not overlap with any existing bookings (different time slot or different resource)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and all entered values are displayed correctly

steps.action: Submit the scheduling request by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and performs conflict detection check within 2 seconds

steps.action: Observe the system response for any conflict alerts
steps.expectedResult: System does not detect any conflicts and proceeds with booking creation without displaying any conflict alerts

steps.action: Verify that a success confirmation message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: System displays a success message confirming the booking has been created successfully

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict log section in the system
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log interface is displayed showing existing conflict entries

steps.action: Check the conflict log for any new entries related to the submitted request
steps.expectedResult: No new entries are added to the conflict log for this non-conflicting booking request

steps.action: Review the user interface for any alert messages
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alert is generated or displayed to the user

steps.action: Verify the new booking appears in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: New booking is successfully created and visible in the scheduling calendar/list view

postconditions: New booking is successfully created in the system
No false conflict entries are logged
Scheduling database is updated with the new booking
User receives confirmation of successful booking
System is ready to accept additional scheduling requests
